column4: This does not provide any real world usage, especially for the tinfoil persona. Any conversation partner can use screen-share capabilities to capture and record messages without alerting their chat partner.

via BTP and Tor, conversation participants who have deleted the given time-based key for their conversation, can achieve deniability, but not unobservability or unlinkability unless the participants both use Tor https://code.briarproject.org/briar/briar-spec/-/blob/master/protocols/BTP.md#23-time-periods

BTP achieves forward secrecy by periodically rotating and deleting the temporary keys. This prevents replay attacks, in theory, but only in rotation mode, which provides Forward Secrecy. https://code.briarproject.org/briar/briar-spec/-/blob/master/protocols/BTP.md#24-key-derivation-for-rotation-mode
From Briar room by akwizgran - BTP, a part of the framework of Briar that provides Forward Secrecy, does so by rotating the symmetric encryption and authentication keys periodically.

https://briarproject.org/how-it-works/ adding contacts must happen within 48 hours, but introductions do not carry a time limit https://code.briarproject.org/briar/briar/-/wikis/FAQ#is-there-a-timeout-for-introductions https://code.briarproject.org/briar/briar/-/wikis/FAQ#is-it-safe-to-publish-my-briar-link-publicly
